abstracts.cdata!:
This partial transcript concerns a joint
            meeting between the International Bank for Reconstruction
            and Development (IBRD) and the International Development
            Association (IDA) over a credit for an education project in
            the Republic of Congo. Urban population in the country grew
            considerably during the 1960s to about forty (40) percent of
            the total population. As a result the education system was
            well developed and relatively advanced; however, its output
            lacked specialists and technicians. This education project
            will reduce the urban workforce shortage in important
            economic sectors like transportation and manufacturing and
            improve the quality of primary and secondary education. The
            countrys interregional transport center accounts for about
            fifty (50) percent of the gross domestic product (GDP), and
            manufacturing services account for about fifteen (15)
            percent of the GDP. The government of the Republic of Congo
            is concerned about skilled personnel to secure proper
            operation of existing infrastructure, as well as assure the
            implementation of planned investments in the future. This
            education project does not involve the sixty (60) percent of
            the population that subsides on agriculture, working in
            forestry, a sector that provides tax incentive to the government.
